Topic.Title: Hey Mr. EE Hubcap...man of Peace...answer up.

Message.Msg: We are on the same page my friend. Yes Win, being union helped me and my family. I doubt we would be in our position today had I not been union. As for the Ricky bunch, I don't read their stuff, so I could care less what they post. They are on ignore. I take care of my business and that's all I can do despite who the president is. Let me respond to your last paragraph about taxes. I had 2 taxable IRA's in my retirement account. I converted them both to Roth's at great expense. We just sent the IRS and the state of Ca. 155K 3 weeks ago for last years conversion. I also have to ante up another 80K apx. by next January 13 for estimated taxes for the second Roth conversion I did in February of this year. I staggered yearly, them so as to not take a hit that might have been a budget-buster. Now, I can collect tax-free and not face MRD's at 70 1/2 as well. It also means I can pass it on to my son via a Trust we have set up and spare him paying taxes. So come 2014, any taxes we pay will be minimal in 2015. Health care is not a factor, as we use Kaiser and I have no complaints about the service they provide. It is excellent. Fortunately, we are in tip-top shape and our needs are minimal regarding medical expenses. Should problems arise, we have ample income to be properly cared for. I always have said one thing about finances Win and it's this. I have ingrained it in my sons mind forever: "It's not how MUCH you make...it's what you DO with what you make". Whether that is original, I don't know. I never read or saw it anyplace to my knowledge. But I take credit for coining it until proven otherwise.

Message.Title: Democrat Sen.Gravel says BO hiding UFO evidence
Message.Msg: Former Sen. Mike Gravel (D-Alaska) says the White House has helped keep the truth about the “extraterrestrial influence that is investigating our planet” from the public. Gravel says the strongest accounts of alien encounters are from former military officers, such as retired Air Force Capt. Robert Salas, who testified that UFOs temporarily disabled nuclear weapons on his watch. “The smoking gun of the whole issue, which is when they saw hovering space craft in Wyoming and South Dakota over the ICBM missile silos that the missiles couldn't work,” Gravel says. Gravel says the media has aided what he sees as a government cover-up by not taking reports of ET encounters seriously. “What we're faced with here is, in areas of the media, and the government too, an effort to marginalize and ridicule people who have specific knowledge,” he says.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ..."Again, where the people are absolute rulers of the land, they rejoice in having a reserve of youthful citizens, while a king counts this a hostile element and seeks to slay the leading ones, all such as he deems discreet, for he feareth for his power." - Euripedes Kent State, May 4, 1970 – The Day the War Came Home “What then is time? If no one asks me, I know what it is. If I wish to explain it to him who asks, I do not know.” – Saint Augustine “Poverty wants some things, Luxury many things, Avarice all things.” – Benjamin Franklin “I have often thought that however learned you may talk about it, one knows nothing but what he learns from his own experience.” – Christoph Martin Wieland "There's now talk here in California of letting noncitizens serve on juries. The bad news: If you're ever on trial for underpaying your nanny, you could get the death penalty." - Jay Leno “The tragedy of modern man is not that he knows less and less about the meaning of his own life, but that it bothers him less and less.” – Vaclav Havel “End discrimination. Hate everybody.” – Elle Eden "Conservatives like me know that in a budget crisis, everything nonessential has to go -- whether it's food for kids who aren't mine or some other stuff for people I don't know." –Stephen Colbert “The wonder is, not that the field of stars is so vast, but that man has measured it.” – Anatole France “If it takes a bloodbath, let's get it over with.” – California Governor Ronald Reagan, three weeks before the Kent State Massacre.

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ...“A man who trusts nobody is apt to be the kind of man nobody trusts.” – Harold MacMillan “I’d just as soon play tennis with the net down.” – Robert Frost "There's a trend now of prison inmates reviewing their prison on Yelp. The downside is that people are now committing crimes just to get the amazing fish tacos at Rikers Island." - Conan O'Brien “He no play-da-game. He no make-a-da rules!” - Earl Butz, referring to the Pope's stricture against contraception “We should not pretend to understand the world only by the intellect. The judgement of the intellect is only part of the truth.” – Carl Gustav Jung "New York City is testing a new plan that would make the average school day longer by over two hours. Parents haven't commented on the plan yet because they're busy high fiving everyone they know." - Jimmy Fallon “Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.” – Steve Wozniak “It appears to me that one defeats the fanatic precisely by not being a fanatic oneself, but on the contrary by using one's intelligence.” – George Orwell "Washington Wizards center Jason Collins has become the first American athlete in a major team sport to come out as gay. Do you know what a breakthrough this is? Finally an NBA player who won't have any illegitimate kids." - Jay Leno "The forces of authority had gotten away with murder." – Philip Caputo, “13 Seconds: A Look Back at the Kent State Shootings”

Message.Title: AHQ (3)...
Message.Msg: ...“Not in mine eyes alone is Paradise.” – Dante "90 percent of people support background checks, which means even people who can't pass a background check support background checks." - Bill Maher "Congratulations to Gwyneth Paltrow. She's the most beautiful woman alive, according to People magazine. I thought to myself, 'Wow. Thank god, finally some hope for good-looking, thin blondes.' Gwyneth, by the way, still has to be confirmed by Congress." - David Letterman “Morality has nothing in common with politics.” – Bob Dylan “Carpe diem! Rejoice while you are alive; enjoy the day; live life to the fullest; make the most of what you have. It is later than you think.” – Horace “Carpe PER diem! Seize the check.” – Robin Williams "A new study found that the air quality in New York City subways is actually the same quality as the air in New York streets. Even crazier, that's supposed to be good news." - Jimmy Fallon “The tendency to turn human judgments into divine commands makes religion one of the most dangerous forces in the world.” – Georgia Harkness "Researchers now believe the first settlers who settled in America, in Jamestown, resorted to cannibalism. The first settlers ate each other. Good thing that didn't catch on. That would have changed Thanksgiving, don't you think?" - Jay Leno “The May 4 shootings at Kent State need to be remembered…the shootings have come to symbolize a great American tragedy which occurred at the height of the Vietnam War era, a period in which the nation found itself deeply divided both politically and culturally. The poignant picture of Mary Vecchio kneeling in agony over Jeffrey Miller's body will remain forever as a reminder of the day when the Vietnam War came home to America.” – The May 4 Shootings at Kent State: The Search for Historical Accuracy, Jerry M. Lewis & Thomas R. Hensley

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ...“If I had influence with the good fairy who is supposed to preside over the christening of all children, I should ask that her gift to each child in the world be a sense of wonder so indestructible that it would last throughout life.” – Rachel Carson "In President Bush's high school yearbook, he was voted least likely to have a library named after him." - Jay Leno “It was luxuries like air conditioning that brought down the Roman Empire. With air conditioning their windows were shut, they couldn't hear the barbarians coming.” – Garrison Keillor “Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson "They are now reviewing prisons on Yelp. Although you do get your standard restaurant gripes, like 'service took forever, was there for 25 years." - Stephen Colbert “It is time to get drunk! So as not to be the martyred slaves of Time, get drunk; get drunk without stopping! On wine, on poetry, or on virtue, as you wish.” – Charles Baudlaire "Jason Collins is getting credit for being the first openly gay pro athlete. Or as Martina Navratilova put it, 'Hello’?” - Jimmy Fallon “As a sleuth you are poor. You couldn’t detect a bass-drum in a telephone-booth.” – P.G. Wodehouse "They had a big opening of the Bush Library down in Texas. All five living presidents were there. It was a once in a lifetime event – a library in Texas."… I kid Texas, but the last person in that state to get near a schoolbook was Lee Harvey Oswald." - Bill Maher “A man is a very small thing, and the night is very large and full of wonders.” – Lord Dunsany “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 "Tin soldiers and Nixon coming, We're finally on our own. This summer I hear the drumming Four dead in Ohio."
